page.title: 04THE RIVER EDEN
page.content: The river is one of the very few{north {flowing}rivers in England.It passes through {Stenkrith }where there are water-falls and interesting shapes in the rock where the water has eaten away at it.There are also places where people swim and the ruins of an old mill.The water at {Stenkrith}was used to make electricity for the station but now the system and the station are closed. The river then flows through farmland and under Franks Bridge which used to be used for packhorses going to { {Nateby.}Round here can be seen {sand- {stone and Brockram.}Next it passes the cricket and football pitches before reaching Lowmill Bridge once the site of two mills.After passing under the New Bridge on the A685 the river follows the old Appleby road.Lots of people fish in the Eden for trout.
